nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't this be the first thing in the life cycle? Or minimally in this method? Previous code paths might already started to use the perf logger.

I had to read this comment several times to understand. Does this mean:
"A single Driver can run multiple queries at the same time, and txn manager is shared between these queries"?
Maybe some rewording could help

It might be better message that it was interrupted "before acquiring the locks"
Also getting the locks might take serious amount of time, so it might worth check for interrupt after it too. What do you think
Putting this to the "else" part seems counterintuitive for me
This will collide @mustafaiman's concurrent pull request. You might have to rebase this change
We still do not want to get rid of this method here and call the txnmanager directly?
How could this happen? Maybe at least a debug level log would be good.
What does this public method do? Javadoc might be useful
Javadoc maybe here too, but at least it is easier to understand :)
Won't we miss this state setting?
Won't we miss setting the query id?
Maybe a correct javadoc comment? The meaning and the usage of resetTaskIds is not trivial either
